questionListItems.title:
What happens during dismissal if my child is attending the school-based Student Care Centre (Little
Professors @ Westwood Primary)?

answer.body:
• For pupils going to the school-based Student Care Centre (Little Professors), they will wait at the level
walls to be picked up by their respective SCC teachers.
• If there are ad-hoc changes in dismissal arrangement, please inform the respective SCC teachers as
they will be taking attendance, including bringing the child to the correct dismissal point.

questionListItems.title:
What happens during dismissal if my child is taking the school bus or going to the external Student
Care Centre (SCC)?

answer.body:
• For pupils taking the school bus, they will be picked up by the school bus attendant at the school bus
waiting area. When all pupils have gathered, the bus attendant will bring them to board the school bus.
• For pupils going to the external SCCs, they will gather at the sheltered basketball court where their
respective external SCC teachers will pick them up.• If there are ad-hoc changes in dismissal

arrangement, please inform the respective SCC teachers as they will be taking attendance, including
bringing the child to the correct dismissal point.

questionListItems.title: Can I drive into the school to drop off my child in the morning?

answer.body:
Yes, parents may drive into the school compound to drop off their child at the designated drop off
point in front of the foyer during reporting time.
• To ensure smooth traffic flow, please remind your child to get ready his bag and alight upon arrival.

questionListItems.title: Can I park in the school to wait for my child during dismissal?

answer.body:
Vehicles are NOT allowed to enter the school at dismissal time for the safety of our pupils. Please park
at the neighboring carparks before waiting for your child at the designated parent holding areas.

questionListItems.title: Does the school organize open house?

answer.body:
We have school tour led by Student leaders, usually held in May.
• We will post an announcement on our school website and Facebook at
https://www.facebook.com/westwood.primary

questionListItems.title: What are the communication channels between school and parents?

answer.body:
Letters, Announcements and Consent Forms will be sent via Parents Gateway (PG) to parents. So
please come onboard the PG if you have not done so.
• An introduction letter with email addresses of the Subject Teachers will be given to pupils on the first
day of school. Parents can email the teachers or call the General Office to leave a message for the
teachers to return the call when they are available. The response time for teachers to revert to parents
is within 3 school working days.
• Alternative communication platforms e.g. ClassDojo/Telegram may also be set up by the Form
Teachers to communicate with parents. Please check with the Form Teachers on these as they are not
mandatory.

questionListItems.title: What if I need to contact my child urgently?

answer.body:
For urgent cases, parents may call the General Office at 6412 1690 to leave a message and our staff
will pass the message to the child.

questionListItems.title: What is the Pupil Handbook used for?

answer.body:
• The Pupil Handbook contains important school information and pupils use it to record their daily
homework.
• If there are important messages or reminders, teachers may note it down in the Pupil Handbook. It
also serves as a communication channel with the class teachers for short notes/messages. Parents can
leave a note in the handbook and get their child to show it to the class teacher(s).

questionListItems.title: What happens if my child feels unwell during a lesson?

answer.body:
Pupil is advised to inform his/her teacher immediately if he/she feels unwell. He/She will then be sent
to the General Office where the Office staff will attend to him/her.
• Parent/guardian will be informed, especially if the pupil needs to be sent home to see a doctor. Parent
is to make the necessary arrangements to fetch the pupil from the General Office.

questionListItems.title: What if my child loses his/her belongings in school?

answer.body:
• The Lost and Found corner is located in the canteen. Pupils are advised to look through the items at
the corner (set up in the centre front of the canteen stall) if he/she has lost something.
• Parents are to assist their child to label all of his/her items e.g. water bottle, lunchbox, wallet, pencil
case or mask holder so that he/she is able to identify them, if found.
• Pupils have to be responsible for their own belongings and the school shall not replace or provide
restitution for lost or damaged personal belongings.
• Valuables, electronic games, cards and toys should not be brought to school.

questionListItems.title: Can my child bring mobile/electronic communication devices to school?

answer.body:
• Mobile phones, smart watches or any devices capable of communicating, capturing and storing images
should not be brought to school.
• Pupils found to be using these devices during lessons, will have them confiscated and items will be
returned only to their parents.
• School will also not be held responsible for any loss of these valuable devices.

questionListItems.title: Can my child use the lift if his/her school bag is heavy?

answer.body:
All pupils are not allowed to use the lift, except for pupils who are unwell or injured with permission
given by their Form/subject teachers.
• All P1 classrooms are situated at level 1. Hence there is minimal need for P1 pupils to move up the
staircase with their school bags.

questionListItems.title: What type of bag should I get for my child?

answer.body:
Bags of lightweight material with padded straps and few compartments are recommended for school.
Trolley bags are discouraged as they can also be hazardous and cause accidents, if not handled well.
• Total weight of the school bag should not exceed 3.5 kg to 4 kg, or 10 to 15 percent of the child’s
weight.

questionListItems.title: How many sets of school uniform should I purchase for my child?

answer.body:
• You may consider purchasing at least 3 sets for your child so after laundry they get to wear a clean set
each day. Parents can purchase more sets if required.
• From P3 onwards, pupils can wear their house t-shirts with black shorts on days when they are having
PE lessons. Parents can consider purchasing 2 sets.

questionListItems.title: How long does my P1 child needs to put on the temporary name tag?

answer.body:
Pupils should wear the customised temporary name tag during the first month of school, i.e. January
2022 or until the personalised name tags purchased from the School Bookshop have been sewn onto
their uniforms.
